message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $950,000. It's a fair price considering its value to you. Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, given my budget constraints, I am only able to offer $850,000 for the product. I hope this aligns better with your expectations.

Bob, I understand your constraints. I'm willing to come down to $900,000. This price still allows you to make a good profit, and it's closer to my expectations. I'm confident this product will be a valuable asset for your business.

Alice, thank you for adjusting your offer. I appreciate your flexibility. Based on my calculations and considering the current market conditions, I believe $875,000 would be a fair price for both of us. I look forward to your response.

Bob, I appreciate your continued interest in the product. While I understand your position, $875,000 is still a bit lower than my target. To finalize this deal, I'm willing to come down to $925,000. This price reflects the product's unique benefits and its potential for your business. I'm confident this will be a mutually beneficial agreement.

Alice, thank you for your latest offer. I've carefully considered our previous discussions and the value of the product. I would like to propose $890,000 as a fair price for the product. I believe this offer strikes a balance between respecting the value of the product and staying within my budget constraints. I hope we can reach an agreement that works for both of us.
